posts.post_content: He may ignore Death, but he can't ignore Infect.
posts.html:

Posted By: NecroticNobody (9/23/2010 7:10:25 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This. lady's and gentlemen, is the honest to goodness flagship Mythic of the set. This is what should be by the definition of a Mythic Rare. It represents the set, leaves an impression, but isn't necessary for tournament play and it isn't an automatic inclusion in decks.  
  
It also tag teams nicely with Platinum Angel. She's one of the few forces that can stop poison counters from killing you, but lets you drop to negative life. This big o'le loveable guy braces you against the most savage facebeatings so you can still live if someone nixes him, but he's hopeless against Infect in general. The Platinums make a cute couple. :P
posts.html:
This. lady's and gentlemen, is the honest to goodness flagship Mythic of the set. This is what should be by the definition of a Mythic Rare. It represents the set, leaves an impression, but isn't necessary for tournament play and it isn't an automatic inclusion in decks.

It also tag teams nicely with Platinum Angel. She's one of the few forces that can stop poison counters from killing you, but lets you drop to negative life. This big o'le loveable guy braces you against the most savage facebeatings so you can still live if someone nixes him, but he's hopeless against Infect in general. The Platinums make a cute couple. :P

Posted By: CeremonialBathory (12/8/2010 9:07:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's a good thing that the Emperion has no evasion abilities or it would be stupidly overpowered. I like this card a lot, but, as another very powerful artifact, it makes me look upon [Darksteel Forge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Forge) with even more disbelief. I simply can't understand how anyone at Wizards could think that designing a card like that would be a good idea. We're still waiting for "all enchantments you control are indestructible/have shroud". At least [Sterling Grove](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sterling Grove) has the decency to exclude itself.  
  
But I digress.  
  
This card doesn't have to guard you for the whole game. It's better to have it for a few late-game turns in case, say, you're playing [Bitterblossom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bitterblossom), things just aren't going your way, and you suddenly realize that losing 1 life each turn could cost you the game. Platinum Emperion will buy you extra time, but don't be too incensed when it dies. It's a huge target, and as an artifact creature, every colour has an easy way of destroy... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

I like this card a lot, but, as another very powerful artifact, it makes me look upon Darksteel Forge with even more disbelief. I simply can't understand how anyone at Wizards could think that designing a card like that would be a good idea. We're still waiting for "all enchantments you control are indestructible/have shroud". At least Sterling Grove has the decency to exclude itself.

But I digress.

This card doesn't have to guard you for the whole game. It's better to have it for a few late-game turns in case, say, you're playing Bitterblossom, things just aren't going your way, and you suddenly realize that losing 1 life each turn could cost you the game. Platinum Emperion will buy you extra time, but don't be too incensed when it dies. It's a huge target, and as an artifact creature, every colour has an easy way of destroy... (see all)

leyline of anticipation
  
elvish spirit guide

channel
